result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Riel Etienne Magnan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Riel Etienne Magnan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Riel Etienne Magnan was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Riel Etienne Magnan was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 5.
Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 4 and 7.
Defendant to report to Probation today March 2, 2016 by 3:00 p.m.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #15CF418.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #15CF418.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 45 days and follow recommended treatment.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Maintain employment.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Thomas, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Eric L Newmark   DF:  Riel Etienne Magnan appeared. Case called at 1:42 pm. Atty Newmark recites agreement. No objection from ADA Correll.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #1, #3 and #6.  Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #1, #3 and #6. Court withholds entering conviction in Count #1 in favor of Diversion Agreement. Counts #2 and #5 dismissed. Counts #4 and #7 are read and dismissed for purposes of restitution. Parties make sentencing arguements. 
On Counts #3 and #6, Court orders: 2 years probation w/h with conditions -
- 120 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs; #243.00 - on one count only
- DNA Surcharge; $200.00 - on one county only
- Restitution - already paid.
- AODA
- 30 hrs of Community Service
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Maintain Employment
- Sign up for probation by 3:00 pm on 3/2/2016
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
